title.narrative: Improving sexual and reproductive health of the Shipibos phase II

description.narrative: This project is a continuation of the ongoing project ?Sexual and reproductive health project of the Shipibos? which takes place in Masisea near Pucallpa in four Shipibo villages in Ucayali region in Peru during 2012-2014.Among the Shipibo indigenous commu nities in the Peruvian jungle there is a lack of understanding about sexual and reproductive health (SRH) leading to sexually transmitted infections (STIs) and unwanted pregnancies. These communities have little access to SRH services and no information of their legal rights to have these services provided by the Peruvian government.The direct objective of the project is to improve the sexual and reproductive health of the Shipibo population in an culturally appropriate way.In this continuation project (the second phase) the communities will have a more active role in developing public policies advocacy and oversight at the local and regional levels. The delivery of mobile healthcare and educational services created in the first phase (known as the mobile he alth care model) will be strengthened and an intercultural care protocol developed for replication in other parts of the country. Local and regional authorities will improve their capacity to design culturally relevant health policies. Parallel to these pr oposed activities mobile SRH service visits will continue in the four project communities
